attributes.additional_details:
I believe the Government should implement Justice Lord Leveson's report recommendations in full. I do not see these recommendations as being contrary to having a free press or that legislating around this is somehow crossing a line that should not be crossed. In any case it is for the to public say if that line is okay to cross not for the press or our politicians to decide.
This is a detailed enquiry which took a lot of time and cost a lot of money, so what was the point of commissioning it if then not to do as it suggests?
